title: A beautiful display that's been modified from its original form
content:
If someone could help me identify the origins of this font that would be great! Need to use it for a campaign.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003854im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-02-06%20at%204_5648.36.04%20PM.png)
author: thinkingloudly

comments.content: Nevermind, I found it! Bujardet Freres.

Happy you found it. FYI this is a Classic Tuscan. Oldest version available as digital is Figgins Tuscan [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/figgins-tuscan/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003854/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/figgins-tuscan/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/figgins-tuscan/") Other well made versions include Michael Hagemann's Miss Scarlett Plain [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/miss-scarlett/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003854/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/miss-scarlett/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/miss-scarlett/") Another similar is Muskitos Caps [http://www.identifont.com/show?9CZ](http://web.archive.org/web/20140405003854/http:/www.identifont.com/show?9CZ "http://www.identifont.com/show?9CZ")  
Don

I note that the License for Bujardet Freres states "Personal use only, no commercial use." Don't know if you can still contact the author for permission.  
Don
